result.execSummary:
The defendant William C Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
09:47 AM Defendant William C Long in court.  Daniel McGrath appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. He states he does not wish to have counsel. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today. Court encourages him to apply to Public Defender.
Kelly Ament appears by video, is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney McGrath. She is a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. On 1/25/22, he stopped a vehicle for a traffic violation. The defendant was the driver of the vehicle and identifies him in the courtroom. He had a canine with her and the canine indicated on the vehicle. The defendant was searched and a glass cylinder was found and a circular pill was found. The pill was identified as Oxycodone. Defendant stated that the pill was not his and received it from a friend. Oxcodone is a narcotic and is available by prescription only.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
***This notice was not sent to the Wood County Jail- Mailed to new address on file 1/28/22 KC***
